newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: PRESS DIGEST - Saudi newspapers - Aug 7.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Saudi newspapers - Aug 7.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the
Saudi Arabian press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and
does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Cigarette prices rise by 30 to 50 percent from Wednesday after tariff
- Saudi Arabia to begin international mobile phone service with France, South Africa, Singapore, Gibraltar and Switzerland.
- Around 87 percent of Saudi Arabian Airlines' jobs to be held by Saudis by the end of the year 2001.
- Riyadh to be hub of South African Gulf diplomatic missions.
- A mosque financed by King Fahd in Los Angeles will be completed in one month.
- Joining the World Trade Organisation (WTO) is a priority for the commerce ministry, minister says.
